text: so this is our ellipsometry mm mm of
sanitary firm woolen company which we
call wali for short so this the purpose
of an ellipse ometer is to measure
thicknesses of really thin films so this
has an accuracy of sub angstrom and you
can measure films from one or two
nanometers all the way to a couple of
microns the concept of ellipsometry is
really simple basically the concept is
that when you reflect light off of a
surface different polarizations of light
are going to react differently now to
simplify that if you go to the beach
with your polarized sunglasses and you
look at a very shallow angle and rotate
your sunglasses or turn your head back
and forth you'll see that the color of
the surface of the lake is going to
change it's going to go from dark to
bright and back and that basically tells
you that the angle of the light that's
reflecting back changes the intensity
that you can get off of that reflection
angle we use this concept by shining a
white light onto a substrate that's
reflective and we look at the
polarization of the reflected light and
as you change the film thickness the
polarization angle is going to slightly
rotate and based on that you could get
really accurately the thickness of the
film and its index of refraction and
even though it's a very simple method is
very useful in characterizing Tim films
in applications like electronics or when
we want to measure glass transition
temperature my name is Zara Farah and
I'm an assistant professor here at the
university of pennsylvania chemistry
department
